revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.

hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, there's this thing on my skin that looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. Also, this spot keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. And there are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. Plus, there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Oh, and sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles, and it’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.

Thank you for providing detailed information. Given what you've described, I have some concerns about the lesion on your skin. Could you tell me more about the borders or edges of the spot? Are they smooth and well-defined, or are they irregular, blurred, or jagged?
I haven’t really paid attention to the edges, but I’ll try to describe them better. They don't seem perfectly smooth and well-defined.
Thank you for the additional information. Now, regarding the spot, are there any different colors within it? Does it have more than one shade, or is it all one color?
I haven’t really paid attention to the colors specifically.
Okay, thanks. Does this spot ever feel itchy?
It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
Thank you. Does the spot feel tender or painful when you touch it or press on it?
No, it doesn’t hurt to touch.

Also, this spot keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. And there are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. Plus, there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Oh, and sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles, and it’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
